reviews: We chose La Valise based off of a recommendation from friends, and even knowing how much they loved it we were still blown away. It exceeded all expectations! The staff is so friendly (thank you Emily, Icker, JP & Carlos!), the property is absolutely stunning and the service was incredible. We can't imagine staying anywhere else when we visit Tulum again. We stayed in a Jungle Suite, a comfortable & beautiful room tucked away in a corner of the property. Communicating with the staff through WhatsApp was so easy, and they were always very responsive, whether we needed to change our car service to the airport or needed a drink on the beach. Breakfast every day was delicious. La Valise is simply paradise!

Everything just PERFECT ! Amazing food and beach !!! All products are very very good !! Amazing Benedict eggs ... amazing shrimp tacos ....  The staff is really really very nice !!  The massage on the beach was perfect also .,.. best part of our trip !! Much much recommended !!!!

My husband and I spent 6 days at La Valise Tulum to celebrate our 30 anniversary and had an amazing vacation.  The property is absolutely beautiful, with very tasteful decor, a lot of open spaces and stylish rooms.  The staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home: they always greeted us with a smile, they always remembered our names, they helped us make restaurant reservations and find fun excursions to do.  We are especially thankful to Carlos, who greeted us with a smile every morning and made sure we always had whatever we needed when we were out on the beach.  Their food is fantastic too!  It is very tasty and healthy.  I can't say enough good things about this hotel, I would love to go back as soon as an opportunity arises.

A perfect getaway.  The resort is beautiful, the staff is helpful and friendly and the food and drink is very good.  It’s a very intimate and quiet setting, very different from the large resorts in other beach resort areas.  The natural look and feel of the resort is relaxing, just a peaceful place to spend time and get away from our busy work life.  Whatever it is that we asked or needed, the service staff was there to help.  Reservations, recommendations, transportation etc…all taken care of by the exemplary staff.  I can’t wait to go back.

La Valise was better than we even expected. The facilities were top notch. The food and drinks were incredible. But the people and service at La Valise really set it apart from other locations. This is the best place to stay in Tulum. I couldn't recommend it enough.

My wife and I just celebrated our honeymoon at La Valise and can't say enough about this beautiful property and the wonderful people that work here. Emily and Josefina at the Concierge desk were absolutely on point with helping us set up airport transport, restaurant reservations, scooter rental, in-room/beach/pool dining and every other aspect of our trip that made our stay absolutely seamless. The property itself is breathtaking and unlike anywhere else we have ever stayed. You feel like you are staying in a good friend's home. The beach is kept pristine and the pool at Radhoo is absolutely incredible. The oceanfront master suite is the coolest treehouse I've ever stayed in and the room was kept absolutely immaculate throughout our stay. Just cannot say enough things about

We had the most wonderful stay at la valise. Even before we arrived the wonderful hotel staff had reached out to see how the could make our stay even better. We walked in and were greeted with such friendly faces- each staff member was so kind and helpful and nothing was too much for them. Our room Was lovely and the bed comfortable and the space of the hotel just gorgeous. The private beach area is so relaxing and the service was perfect! Thank you for everything! X

Thank you for the most wonderful stay. La Valise is a quiet little hidden paradise - stunning views and beautiful rooms right by the sea. I wish I could have stayed longer. Also the absolute kindest, most attentive and lovely staff - they were all so friendly and helpful and discreet. The best service I have had in all Tulum. I feel very lucky to have stayed.   Gracias Gracias Gracias!  Xxx

I stayed in a room with an ocean view and it was absolutely stunning!! and the room itself is so so cool I loved eating breakfast overlooking the jungle and the beach every morning, the food is really good and the service is perfect, waking up to the view was so lovely and I genuinely felt so relaxed and taken care of by the staff who are SO kind and helpful! really great experience <3

The best in Tulum. Service is uncomparable and staff absolutely helpful & adorable. They go over and beyond to please their guests and always available.  Hotel only has 11 rooms so they really focus with few to give the best.

Loved the property. So serene and peaceful. The staff was very friends and did everything to make our stay comfortable. They were very prompt and quick. Completely completely recommend coming here. No complains at all..

Just home after a relaxing weeks stay at La Valise. Immediately felt very welcomed by all the staff, whose service was exceptional throughout the week. We had a lower beach front room and an upper jungle room, the latter of which was extremely spacious. The breakfasts in the lobby were delicious and substantial, with beautiful views over the beach. La Valise is an oasis of calm, but still close enough to participate in all the nightlife Tulum has to offer. We loved it!

Everything perfect!  The people are overwhelmingly nice and friendly. The foot is awesome (both the hotel one and their restaurant in front of the hotel), beach is perfect and beach support is great.  Beautiful room with great view.  Definitely a spot to stay!

WOW WOW WOW WOW WOW! Where to start?! We stayed in the Master Suite and the bed literally rolls out onto the balcony!! We moved it out there and watched the stars - absolutely one of the best experiences of my life! Could not recommend La Valise more highly - the staff, the room, the location, the design ... everything! I wish I lived there! Falling asleep watching the moonlight dance on the ocean top is a memory I will cherish forever!

My wife and I stayed here for a week for our honeymoon during July (which is one of the slower months in Tulum in terms of the number of people visiting there).   We stayed in the Upper Jungle Suite. We loved the room (it was very spacious, offered plenty of privacy and has an awesome vibe (decorations, adjustable lighting, etc.). We also really loved the outdoor shower that the Jungle Suite offers. Overall the hotel is amazing! It is right on the beach (has private beach access and has nice daybeds) and it is a really cool property. This hotel has 11 rooms, but there were many times during our stay where we felt like the only guests at the hotel.   The staff was also incredible and really added to the already great experience. They are very friendly and attentive and we were

Everyone who has commented on the beautiful hotel and great service is absolutely right.  The staff is attentive and thoughtful, the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are lovely.  The only complaint I have is about our jungle side room, which backed up to the alleyway and dumpsters.  We could hear every time someone took out the garbage, whenever someone was on break and on the phone, or when the trash truck came by early in the morning.  Highly recommend this hotel, but spring for an ocean-side room!

This hotel is quality, luxury, ambience and service all in one. Everything at La Valise is beyond exceptional. JP and his team *chef’s kiss* in helping make your experience memorable. I have not one, even slightly, subpar thing to say about La Valise.   Thank you JP for giving us an amazing experience in Tulum!

I have just returned from a dreamy weekend in Tulum. I was tempted not to write a review, to avoid sharing this hidden gem with the world. But I don’t want to be selfish and will share my enthusiasm…  From the moment we arrived at La Valise, we felt like we were staying at a friend’s chic beach house, rather than a hotel. The décor is impeccable and just blends in perfectly with the surroundings.   Every morning, we enjoyed breakfast on the terrace with views of the white sandy beach and the ocean. The breakfast is definitely a hightlight. Not just for the quality of the food (the home-made granola is fantastic), but the quality of the service. Our server, Carlos, who knew our names from day one, always remembered our preferences, anticipated our wishes and needs, and was a

The grounds are lush and tropical, very rustic yet  strangely elegant!  We had booked the entire hotel for my daughter’s wedding, so I saw each room… and they are each different yet equally well appointed and welcoming. More than one guest commented that they enjoyed the most comfortable sleep of their lives in the super comfy beds! Finally, the food and staff: absolutely delicious! Food was a grand slam, only to be surpassed by the level of service!  You will always remember your trip to La Valise. It will be one of the most lovely you will ever take!

We had the most amazing stay at La Valise. The hotel was beautiful, everything was so well-organized and peaceful. so far it was the best hotel in Mexico. Perfect for a honeymoon getaway, lovely beach, amazing and welcoming staff members who helped us at every moment. Book it and dont think twice!

La Valise Tulum is exceptional.  My husband and I spent a long weekend here, our first couple's getaway post-baby.  Everything was perfect- the rooms were immaculately designed with practicality and beauty in mind.    The location on the Tulum beach strip is ideal- a quiet, romantic oasis that is easily walkable to everything.  The service is A++, breakfast is delicious, great WiFi and there are many places to relax right on the beach.  I also had a wonderful, 90-minute deep tissue massage on the beach, which I'd urge you to take advantage of.   Overall, highly recommend.  Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer!

Excellent food, drinks and rooms. Moreover, incredible staff. Hands down the most genuinely welcomed I’ve ever felt in any hotel in the world. Best place to stay in Tulum; we were there for a week in our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute.

My wife and I intended to stay at La Valise for the second half of our honeymoon in Tulum. For the first half, we had booked Radhoo across the street, La Valise's sister property. Upon arrival, we walked over to look at La Valise and explore the beach (as it was included as part of our stay at Radhoo).   While we were aware that we had arrived at the tail end of seaweed season we were surprised that the beach was not only covered in it, but the stench made it impossible to sit and relax and the water was unswimmable.   According to La Valise's Instagram page, what we were seeing did not add up. So, we looked back and discovered that had been recycling the same images throughout the summer to make it appear as though the beach was free of seaweed and the water crystal clear. Not

Would highly recommend!  Absolutely beautiful, aesthetic hotel with perfect touches everywhere. Small and boutique with barefoot luxe vibes. Morning sun with amazing day beds, and afternoon sun by the stylish pool, with hammocks and palm trees added in - bliss!  Located in the best part of the Tulum hotel strip, away from the noise and traffic but close enough to reach great restaurants and smoothie spots!

We were at La Valise for a wedding - and they made it a weekend we will never forget. The staff were incredibly friendly, always ready to help with any odd request, and always available. The venue it self was beautiful - all the amenities worked exactly how you would hope; with extra special details sprinkled everywhere. The food was superb.

Upon arrival the staff at La Valise were friendly, welcoming and excited to see us. We stayed a long weekend for our friends wedding and we’re treated with the best care the entire time. I love them!!

The resort, staff and entire experience was 11/10! I’d recommend this resort for years to come! Carlos staff was amazing, Ikr amazing, Lorena an absolute delight.  They knew you personally after day one and had meals ready to go, drinks ready to go.

Just the most incredible stay, better than we could have ever imagined. We stayed at La Valise for a week in November, and it really was the most perfect stay. We went for our honeymoon and the whole team at La Valise went above and beyond. The service was outstanding, from check in to breakfast to dinner, everyone and everything was just perfect. Shout out to Carlos, one of the waiter's, who made our day every day with how friendly and kind he was. We can't recomend La Valise enough and will definitely, definitely be back. The concierge team are so friendly and personal, they put a smile on our face every day! The food throughout was incredible. The rooms are beautiful. Service incredible. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We can't wait to come back!!

We had a really amazing stay in La Valise. The place is exceptionaly designed, both the rooms and the common areas.  Rodrigo and the staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming, we had a whatsapp group which made it really convient.  Breakfast and restaurant were also great!

We loved how small the place was and upon talking to others at different resorts, we feel we made the right choice for accommodations. Tulum is a unique and beautiful location. La Valise Tulum made our anniversary trip even more special with their hospitality and special attention to details.

Our stay at La Valise was perfect. Our room was on the jungle side. Everything there was great, room, bed, shower, breakfast and pool. I’ve been in a few very good hotels around the world, but the service of La Valise was just perfect, specially the concierge Lorena who was very helpful and friendly.

La Valise is Paradise, it’s located on the best section of beach in Tulum. Their entire team is so helpful and responsive, especially the Concierges and the parking attendants who took good car of our car! We also loved our little Palapa.

Celebrated our 10 year anniversary at La Valise. It did not disappoint. The staff is awesome! Super kind, helpful and always available. Breakfast was really good. Hotel is small and quiet. Feels like you're staying at a home on the beach. The view is incredible and the master suite was well worth the money!! We would most definitely go back!

This was a great place. The concierge staff was extremely friendly, and they all knew your name. They  💯 took care of everything asked. Also, Carlos in the restaurant was a gem. The property is beautiful, and a gorgeous oasis from the strip. My room was huge and the AC a total relief. I would highly recommend. But be prepared to pay for it!! $$$$

Really lovely and relaxing. The hotel is so small that the staff really gets to know you and is always attentive. Special attention to all of the front desk people and Carlos and Radolfo in service.  There could be more clarity on the site re Jungle Side vs Jungle facing, etc. to really understand the geography of the place. We had a jungle facing room that overlooked some trash and trees, but moved to a beach side room that was amazing.   All in all a wonderful trip.

La Valise Tulum is a slice of paradise. My husband and I were looking to relax, and this was the perfect place for it. The staff went above and beyond, and the site was just beautiful. We stayed in a jungle room, and it was so comfortable and private, but walking distance to many restaurants and shops. We would 100% stay here again on our next trip to Tulum.

Was our second vsit at La Valise Tulum and as always the best experience.Gorgeous garden view room and was breathtaking with the interior design.Absolutely worth to visit La Valise Tulum.Excellent service and hospitality.Very peaceful and totally Zen feeling.La Valise will be our place everytime we visit Tulum.

I really enjoyed the simplicity of the hotel and the easy, but professional nature of the staff. We never felt hurried or rushed and everyone was willing to answer all our questions. Our room was simple, comfortable, and mixed modern with historic quite well. We would like to try other Le Valise Properties an build a relationship with the Hotel as preferred guests. I do believe and Carlos, Angel and Anai should be given a chance to get more education and move up in the organization. Anai particularly.

What an amazing experience, from the moment we landed into the hotel until we checked out. We loved every second of it. The small details, the treatment , the beach, the food, the drinks. All excellent.   We will definitely visit again and we highly recommend it.   A beautiful and peaceful location

Best hote experience I have had. Clean and secluded beach experience, service is top notch (special shout out to Rudolpho and Carlos). Front desk staff very welcoming and very responsive on Whatsapp.  Food is delicious and fresh, they managed to even make granola and yogurt extra special!! We got the upper level beachfront room, the view was phenomenal, I really enjoyed the central shower facing at the view of the beach.  Highly recommend if you want a taste of heaven.

The quality and attention to every detail no matter how minute was exceptional!!    Hotel was just beautiful, location, cleanliness and beyond doubt the staff were exceptional.   We mostly dealt with Paola on the front desk who was fantastic and Lorena over at the spa who gave an exceptional massage and beyond amazing facial!!  Can't recommend the hotel and the staff enough and we will definitely be back

The perfect marriage of nature and decadence. What a lovely, peaceful place to relax and decompress. The food is outstanding, the service is amazing and the rooms are these luxurious sanctuaries in the middle of a jungle. You forget yourself and let "it"all melt away. Thank you to the entire team that made our trip so special.   And thank you Carlos for making that awesome bloody Mary with the tequila. 👊

The best hotel we’ve ever stayed in.   Ikr, Paula, and Lorena on the concierge team = Heroes.   Carlos, the hotel’s maitre d’ = LEGEND.    Paradise is not lost, it’s here in Tulum at La Valise.   If you can, ball out and book the master suite. You will feel like a king or queen.   The fact you can catch a ride on a turtle along the riviera like you’re in Finding Nemo too = WOW!  BOOK NOW OR REGRET IT FOREVER.

We can not explain how special La Valise is. The hotel itself is unbelievably beautiful  - every detail of the property is stunning but it is the staff that made our stay so perfect. Everyone from the front of house team, to the waiters, to the maids went the extra mile to make sure we were as comfortable as possible. We have been fortune enough to stay at some world class hotels in the past but La Valise trumps them all. Thank you for all for making our trip so memorable, we will never forget the time we spent in Tulum. Jaya and Sam xx

Heaven!!  This hotel is what dreams are made of. After tons of research on the hotels in Tulum we could not be happier with our choice of La Valise. The customer service is amazing & personalized. The ambience & decor is breathtaking, exactly what a boutique hotel should be. The food was impeccable…so delicious every time…our compliments to the chefs!  Room was lovely and beds so comfy. Beach and pool area were both gorgeous and relaxing!  Someone who really made our stay special was Carlos. The warmth and care he takes with guests, along with his constant enthusiasm is truly unmatched. He made us feel so comfortable and taken care of at all times. His constant attention to detail was so appreciated and made our stay unforgettable.  The lovely welcome, care and communication

This hotel is the epitome of paradise. I truly cannot get over the amazing service and hospitality that was provided to us by every single staff member we encountered. Becky, Ernesto, Ricardo, and Ivan were incredibly helpful throughout our entire stay. Communication using the WhatsApp was so simple, and we were responded to almost immediately every time we reached out. The food was delicious, the drinks were lovely, the bed was incredibly comfortable, everything was extremely clean, and the beach was absolutely gorgeous. Aside from relaxing on the beautiful beach each day, we loved having our breakfast every morning on our balcony.   I cannot emphasize enough how outstanding every staff member was, they truly made our stay so special. Thank you so much for an amazing

My wife and I wanted to spend a few days celebrating our wedding anniversary in Tulum and ended up booking this hotel at the last minute.  What can I say, the hotel is simply amazing, rooms are unique, extremely clean, and cleaned/prepared twice a day.  Private beach is is just a few steps away.   Can't say enough about the staff and entire concierge team, these guys are the best!  Special thanks to Becky, who helped us a lot with different reservations and made sure that we enjoyed our stay.  And thank you for a number of surprises/presents that we received throughout the stay.   We are definitely coming back soon.

My girlfriend and I got to spend 5 nights at Encantada and it truly matched and exceeded our expectations. The entire staff is incredibly accommodating and more than happy to offer suggestions for restaurants and other activities. We had an Ocean view 2nd floor room and it was perfect for sitting out and watching the sunrise/sunset. The hotel will even bring your meals up to the balcony so you can enjoy a private meal. Speaking of meals the food is delicious, each morning starts with a made to order breakfast that includes items like eggs benedict and huevos rancheros. All the other food we had was delicious as well and the Nu restaurant across the road is the best food we had in Tulum.  All in this is a great property for couples and definitely a standout among the other

Look no further, Encantada was amazing! The service was incredible, the staff, Ricardo, Becky, Ivan, Juan Pablo, everyone. A very special place, I'll never stay anywhere else in Tulum! Thank you and congratulations! Grateful for a magical stay :-)

My husband and I recently travelled to Tulum for a wedding. We stayed at Encantada and couldn’t have asked for a better experience. We stayed in an oceanfront room just steps for the crystal blue ocean. Breakfast was included and was delicious. I am still trying to replicate the house made granola. Ivan and Becky offered fantastic concierge services and were always very helpful if anything was needed at all during our stay. They made getting COVID testing easy and stress free. When we checked out in the morning we were given coffee and lunch for the road to the airport. It was one of the best hotel travel experiences I have had in a very long time. We will definitely return!

This was our third stay at Encantada, and we will definitely be back. We stayed six nights, this time in La Tierra. (There are no bad room at Encantada.) The beach is lovely, food is good and the staff are great. We did a mezcal tasting at the next-door property, La Valise, which is gorgeous. Setting up and doing the covid test to return was super easy.

This is a beautiful location, with exceptional service, and great accommodations. The beach is manicured daily and the drinks. One of my favorite features was that you can receive service anywhere (the beach, your room, or on their outdoor dining room overlooking the beach). The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful and we had a great vacation.

The chipped dishes on which meals are served are the perfect symbol of the last five years of change at this once-fabulous former "couples" resort.   Eager to "activate" spaces, cater to the Insta crowd and squeeze every nickel possible from this property, the owner, a European hospitality group, has ripped the soul from this former paradise. from the crockery to the staff. Therefore, gone are the charming (and durable) terra cotta dishes with pretty little flowers, replaced by too-hip-for-the-room matte black, gray and steely blue stoneware that is intended to be chic but instead mocks the grandiose pretensions of the new Encantada.  At $700+ a night, breakfast on chipped dishes and a teapot with a chipped saucer for a cover are both simply insulting.  Those who have never been

Quiet, restful property. Staff are friendly , courteous and helpful. Huts sre clean. Beds sre restful. Absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a intimate date with nature. Quick walk to all the action, restaurants and shops.

I cannot say enough great things about Encantada! 10/10 recommend. My husband and I went there for a both relaxing and adventuring trip for the first time to Tulum and stayed in the Luna room. We were immediately greeted with amazing customer service from Becky. Everyone on the staff was so incredibly nice (Oscar, JP) and truly cared that we had the best possible time on our stay. They also were very receptive to our needs and tailored the experience to that. The cabana beds were perfect for laying out on and never felt crowded or like you had to rush to grab a spot. The food for breakfast and at the restaurant was so so good! Exceeded our expectations. We ate breakfast on the gorgeous patio overlooking the ocean and tried almost everything on the menu. Everything was delicious,

We stayed at Encatada for 5 days and our stay was perfect! The hotel is calm and quiet. Perfect for relaxation. Our room was clean, big, and the bed was comfortable. The room is cleaned twice a day. Our trip was during the humid summer and we were so greatful to stay at a hotel with AC. The beach at the hotel is clean and due to them only having 8 rooms there were moments when myself & my fiancé had it to ourselves. Also we were very lucky that during our stay in June there was no issues with seaweed. But what makes this hotel amazing is the staff. Every single staff member there was attentive, caring, and friendly. We plan to stay here again in our next trip.

From the moment we arrived Jose Luis grabbed our bags and told us to relax—-we were on vacation!  He was always very helpful and caring with taxis or any questions we had!    Ana from the restaurant was always so friendly and helpful, we just loved our conversations with her and she went above and beyond in her service!  The food was delicious!  Breakfast exceeded my expectations—variety, taste, presentation all superb!   The front desk responded quickly to any needs or questions and offered suggestions—They even made sure to send us off with towels for our day trip when I completely spaced to grab some!   They also had breakfast packed and to go for us as well!    The weather/seaweed didn’t cooperate during our stay and we visited the sister pool as a result.  We really enjoyed

My husband and I stayed at Encantada to celebrate our anniversary. The room was set nicely for the occasion including rose petals in the bed and complementary wine. The rooms as EXACTLY as shows on pictures. Dreamy, romantic and quiet. Perfect for a couple’s getaway.  The staff was incredibly kind, genuine, and helpful.  What we loved the most was how private the location was and how well-maintained the room and amenities were. Very clean, stylish and “effortless look” typical of TUlum.  This hotel is perfect if you’re looking for a low-key, romantic and fine experience away from the Tulum party scene. Food and drinks were good, very well managed breakfast included. We visit the pool at the sister hotel and was also very private and nice. We enjoy a great Couples  massage at the

This place is excellent! The service, the food, the environment!! Nothing to complain about. The beach is beautiful - although we could not use it due to the seawood and the crashing waves, it was still amazing. Private yoga sessions - wonderful! The food, the drinks, the smells, cleanliness! This place is a must!

Superb service from the front desk to beach staff, always there to help, great cocktails! Good location, a quiet enclave in Tulum with restaurants and bars nearby allowing us a wander out for lunch and dinner at our leisure.

My husband and I stayed at Encantada while celebrating a birthday, and we were blown away by the level of service we received and how excellent the experience was. The staff was incredibly kind, genuine, and thoughtful every step of the way. We so appreciated seeing familiar faces each day!  We loved how private the location was and how well-maintained the room and amenities were. Very clean, very elevated and design-forward. The beach is excellent, and the food and drinks were beyond expectation. I’d highly recommend staying here if you’re looking for a low-key yet luxe experience away from the Tulum party scene.

My wife and I stayed at Encantada Tulum for 2 nights and we absolutely loved it! The room was beautiful and offered a unique jungle experience while also having access to a private beach. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, making us feel welcome and comfortable the moment we arrived. We highly recommend staying here!

We visited Encantada as our final hotel on a 3 week trip around Mexico, hoping to have saved the best till last after reading some incredible reviews but we were a little bit underwhelmed.   The hotel itself is stunning, nestled away at the quieter end of Tulum beach and is a perfect escape from the loud beach clubs.   Our room looked great, and had all the amenities that we needed. The bed is so comfy! We did have an issue with noise though - we were on the ground floor and the room above were so loud that we ended up complaining. I dont think anything was done about it however, or at least we weren't told if anything had been. It was a real shame hearing the room above at 4am most mornings and did put a bit of a dampener on things.   We also felt that the staff weren't very

From the moment we were greeted with a welcome drink on our arrival everything at Encantada was special.Oscar (Head Concierge) personally took us to our room,made sure we knew where everything was and then showed us the Beach, Resturant, Bar etc.Each member of the staff greated us by name and with a smile.The service is exceptional and attentive with no reqest being too much trouble.Juan Pablo the manager introduced himself to us at his first oportunity and enquired about our comfort and well being. The conciierge team curated two wonderful day trips from the hotel for us.They selected a guide knowledgeable in Myan culture and The history of Yucatan which made touring the historcal sights extreemly interesting and enlightning. The hotel has only 8 beautiful rooms which alows the

Beautiful hotel with amazing service right on the beach. It only has couple rooms, that it makes it nice and quiet. Also, hotel located further down the road from all the partying which is nice too.  Has an amazing pool in hotel across the street which is accessible at any time.  Great experience! We will love to come back!

We are now home but already  missing the atmosphere we lived at Encantada. All the staff was extremely kind and nice and made us feel like home.  Comfort and relax were the keys of our stay. We would never thanks enough all the Namron hospitality staff. It was all perfect from the time we checked in. Surrounded by nature, you feel cuddled by beautiful landscape, soft music and great staff. Absolutely a must in Tulum.

We stayed here for 7 days for our honeymoon, and everything was seriously perfect. The views and the vibes were perfect and chill. The entire staff was super friendly and the food was delicious. Seriously. Efrain (I’m sorry if I misspelled this), Anais (sorry if I misspelled this), Becky, Oscar, Michael, Jose, JP, all of them were perfect. We will definitely be back! Thank you all for making our honeymoon amazing.

We celebrated our honeymoon in June and spent nine lovely days at Encantada.  Where to begin.. firstly the hotel is stunning and surrounded by huge plants giving us great beach vibes. Our room was stunning and nothing like we've ever experienced- my favourite the hammock and sweet welcome arrival (treats left in our room every evening). Oscar and Becky were the best concierge and always helped with any inquiries or bookings we had. A big shout out to the lovely Annai (I hope I spelt her name correctly) as she gave us excellent service. The service by all the staff were phenomenal and they were always accommodating- 5 star service. We had access to the Radhoo pool which is one of the biggest on tulum beach. Overall this was a very relaxing trip and a honeymoon we will alway

We loved our stay at Encantada. All of the staff are amazing, and the rooms and grounds are so beautiful. The staff did everything to make our stay special! All of their food is great, but the breakfast was our favorite thing. We spent the mornings in a beach cabana and the afternoons at the huge/beautiful salt water pool at their sister hotel right across the street, Radhoo. The concierge also scheduled for us a great, private tour of the Mayan ruins and two cenotes, which we definitely recommend. The hotel located a ways down from the hustle and bustle of Tulum, so it is nice and quiet but just a short walk from some great restaurants.   Thank you to all of the amazing staff! We miss it already!

This is a first class boutique hotel (8 rooms) that is very well run by the manager Juan Pablo (JP). The rooms are spacious, super clean and very well maintained. The well trained and friendly staff (too many to mention individually) provides caring, attentive, and personalized service. The front desk staff (Oscar, Becky, Christopher) is extremely helpful and quick to schedule activities or accommodate special wishes, such as organizing a birthday cake. The kitchen staff provides excellent food selections and is more than willing to create something that is not on the menu. The whole premises provide a feeling of “living in nature”, culminating in the gorgeous beach with lovely cabanas. From the moment we entered through the triangular front structure, we were truly enchanted

The food, the service and the grounds are beautiful. Look no further, this is the place that you should stay while in Tulum.   We loved the ocean view suite and even during the off-season (hot), we were able to open the doors and the ceiling fans coupled with the ocean breeze kept us sufficiently cool (we did not have to rely on the air conditioning and closed doors).   If I make it back to Tulum, this will be the hotel I will choose.

Encantada Tulum was absolutely perfect!! Great location on the beach but a little further down from the busier section (still walkable), wonderful friendly people who attended to my every need with big smiles, excellent accommodations (clean, comfortable and private suite), convenient parking on site.  Don't look anywhere else; this is the only place to stay in Tulum!

This location was absolutely magical. It is such a hidden gem in Tulum and I do not plan on telling many about this beautiful location. The photos are EXACTLY what you get.   Our room was the jungle location. It really doesn't much matter where you're situated as you're able to feel the breeze of the beach and hear the waves either way. You are steps away.   We absolutely loved the breakfast and breakfast selections and were glad to add that to our room package. The lunch and dinner wasn't the best (although ok) and we ended up getting that elsewhere.   We both received massages that were excellent and some of the best we've ever had.   The prices are worth every penny.   You are made to feel as if you are almost at the hotel alone and we loved it. You really only saw people at

Wow! We visited Encantada as the first stop on our honeymoon and it set the bar high. It's an absolutely stunning hotel and location, with ocean views from our bedroom, and just a few step to the beach. We particularly enjoying eating breakfast on the deck every morning.  Encantada has a really warm and welcoming feeling. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and go the extra mile to add little details to make your stay even more magical. We will be back!

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ We planned an amazing honeymoon, Hotel Encantada made it absolutely magical. From gorgeous private bungalows with amazing views to amazing service. The team was personable and made us feel so welcome. Their food was top notch, I would highly recommend their Conchita tacos. If you want a quiet get away while being pampered stay at Hotel Encantada you won't regret it

This was our first visit to Tulum and Mexico and what a magical visit it was!  First of all a massive thank you to all of the staff at Encantada - Oscar, Christopher, Abi (concierge), Marta, Honoria, Marcia (housekeeping), Mauricio and Alfredo (restaurant/bar), and Luis at the front entrance all made our time at the hotel absolutely divine.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and no request is too small or big to ask.    The location is ideal - a short walk to the streets bustling and busy nightlife.  Meaning that you also can get a peaceful night's sleep in an extremely comfortable bed.  The rooms are all gorgeous with everything that you might need!  Breakfast in the morning is an absolute delight with good coffee, fresh fruit bowls with granola and yogurt, and fresh

We picked the perfect place for our first time in Tulum - Encantada! This boutique hotel is located right on the beach with only 8 rooms total all settled on the sand. We had the most relaxing and enjoyable stay thanks to the hotel, our room, the location, the staff, the food, and drinks - all were top notch! Everyone was so attentive, the room impeccable and cozy, our view (Cielo room) amazing, and the food - delicious! We felt completely safe and comfortable walking the main street to stores and restaurants. We loved exploring all the unique "art" that makes Tulum so unique, relaxing on the beach or at the sister property hotel, riding bikes, and more. Thank you to everyone at Encantada! We will definitely return!

I absolutely loved the 4 nights we spent here in the Cielo suite.. the staff was incredibly friendly and hospitable.. I miss them already and hope to return and stay again. I would highly recommend staying here if you want the most intimate setting with your special friend/ partner / spouse. The food and breakfast was super delicious. And the drinks were always on point  i can’t wait to return.

Encantado is located in the best Part of Tulum. The Hotel Area is fantastic and the employees are super fast and friendly. The breakfast is great, we definitely enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Great small hotel with beautiful rooms and comfortable beds.  The view from our balcony on the second floor was fabulous.  Highly attentive and helpful staff.  Really went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay and assist with anything we needed.

Cannot begin to express what an amazing experience we had at Encantada! From the delicious food (hot sauce is unreal, need to bottle that) to the beautiful beach (every person had their own cabana with two comfortable loungers) it was phenomenal… but the service!!! Wow wow wow. They make sure that you feel at home, recommending great places to eat, cool attractions, where the best tattoos are, whatever you need, they make sure you get the best!

There was something magical about our stay at Encantada!   The Lower Beachfront room had a perfect beach view, and we spent hours outside on our patio.  The room was designed well, with a comfortable bed.  The room was pristine, and the Housekeeping staff would come right when we would go to the beach, so after our beach time, we always had a clean room.   We stayed at the Beach most days and the service was excellent (we always had drinks in our hands) and everyone was so nice.  They'd walk around to check on us but we were able to order at any time through What's App (if needed)!   The breakfast every morning was seriously great and each night with turn-down service there were little treats in our room (cookies, croissants, tequila shots, chocolates).  We looked forward to the

We absolutely loved our time staying at Encantada! From the moment we arrived, the whole staff made sure we had everything we needed and were so helpful, kind and friendly, with amazing recommendations and so many personal touches. Our room was beautiful, spacious, and smelt amazing! The food and drinks were delicious and it was so nice to be steps from the beachside cabanas. We were in a quiet area of the beach but were still able to walk to many bars and restaurants. We cannot wait to come back!

We spent four nights at the Encantda, a quaint boutique hotel in Tulum very near the Sian Ka’an Reserve. We booked the oceanfront lower level suite. It was very clean and perfectly appointed. The truth is that it is the staff that make the hotel extra special; they were warm and friendly and very accommodating to our needs (we had many special requests). We highly recommend!

Fantastic place to stay and would recommend for sure. Small boutique hotel with all amenties needed. Fantastic service from the concierge team as well as from all the team.  The food is really nice and you can choose to have it right at the beach or at your terrace. Thanks to the whole team!

This stay was as close to perfect as we could imagine. The service was nothing less than 5 stars. The staff was kind, thoughtful, intuitive, and attentive in a way that always made us feel special.  The rooms themselves are lovely, and waking up to the sunrise everyday was magical. The biggest surprise was that we also had access to several other properties including a beautiful pool, upscale resort, and options for where we wanted spa treatments and yoga. Truly one of the best stays we’ve ever had. Thank you!!

My husband & I had the privilege to stay at the Hotel Encantada this past week. We had a wonderful experience from everything from the perfect location to the excellent staff to the excursions they arranged. If you have the opportunity, drop everything & go!

Super clean, friendly, courteous, and accessible.Highly recommend. The pool was great amenities, very high tech and the staff superb. I felt very safe and secure and access to the beach and supplies in less than 5 minutes.

Cannot say enough good things about Encantada. Oscar, Christopher, Guillermo, were welcoming, warm, and catered to our every need.. being able to use the Pool at one of the family of properties allowed for our experience at Encantada to be serene, peaceful, and the wind coming right off of the beach onto our balcony, fhe  gorgeous sunrises - cannot be beat. Thrilled with our trip.

My husband and I spent a week at Encatada in January.  We absolutely loved the property.  The food and services were impeccable and the entire place felt very safe.  Definitely check out their restaurant, Nü, across the street.  The food and cocktails are fantastic.  There is a free cocktail. hour on Thursdays for guests.  This is the perfect place to relax and unwind with great cocktails, views, and service.

We just got back from our honeymoon. Staying at Encantada was the absolute best. The service, food, accommodations were better than I could have ever imagined or asked for. I hope we can get back here one day. Thank you for such an amazing experience!

From start to finish the experience was magical. The staff is so accommodating and friendly. The hotel is small but very beautiful and private. The food and beverages are excellent including the breakfast that is free with your stay. The room we stayed in, Mar, was so beautiful, the staff is tireless in making sure the room is clean and you have everything you need. This hotel is at the far end of where most action in Tulum is, but everything is in walking distance. I think its the perfect location to enjoy this special hotel's luxury and privacy. There are only 8 suites at this hotel so you will be well taken care. Each room is less than 30ft. from the pristine private beach, which includes cabanas for each guest. You can walk out of your room onto your private deck with a

This was our fourth visit to Encantada.  We went in 2018, 2019, 2021 (with another couple) and this time with our adult daughters.  Normally, we visit the end of October so that we can experience Day of the Dead.  Additionally, that is right before the high season so the prices are more reasonable.  Another individual wrote a review in the fall of last year who had visited this property 3 times and indicated that while everything was pretty good, there were definitely differences and to be quite frank, that review resonated with me and my own experience. I definitely feel as though some of the charm is gone and perhaps it's because Encantada is now part of a large hotel group, Namron.   On a positive note,  the staff at Encantada are truly fantastic and really want to make your

If you’re looking for a place to get far away from the rat race, this is it.  With only 8 thatched roof rooms and enough staff to take care of your every need, you can’t beat this place.  Oscar met us upon arrival and already knew our names and the fact that we were celebrating a birthday. He was so welcoming and friendly and readily helpful in taking care of making recommendations and reservations for dinner and excursions. Even though our room was farthest from the beach, we were only 20 steps away.  There are always chaises available with a choice of sun or shade.  If you prefer a pool, their sister hotel, across the street, is only steps away.  Our waitress, Anna,  was always nearby to provide drinks or snacks.  She seemed to appear with a sweet smile whenever we needed

an intimate feel a beautiful beach visible just outside the room excellent food an incredibly helpful hotel team (one member went wine shopping for us on his own time!) a perfectly choreographed escape (and the mezcal tasting was great)

Check out this Yelp review for Encantada! Video showing the loud drill saw and hammering from sunrise to sunset . Don’t forget the loud music at night  Don’t stay here I want my money back They advertise peace abounds, it doesn't. Loud music past 12am and was told it's just a party meaning I shouldn't  be bothered on my honeymoon that there is loud music all night and constant saws, drills and hammering all day. Worst part of my honeymoon is my stay here. Giving them A chance to make it right, if not I will update with detailed review,sincerely exhausted upset frustrated newlywed DON'T BOOK HERE IF YOU WANT A QUIET ROMANTIC HONEYMOON we did NOT get what we paid for, cried myself to sleep due to stress   #namronhospitality #peaceabounds

Amazing experience and an even better staff. Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. The staff ensured we had as optimal and experience as possible during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel for all of the care and hospitality they bring to your stay. The amenities are all great and the rooms are very well laid out with amazing views.

This place was absolutely amazing! Right near the beach, great cafe overlooking the water as well. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The room was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend! It was walking distance to all the restaurants and beach and even had access to a neighboring hotel's pool.

We had a wonderful time at Encantada. We loved stepping out of our room onto the beautiful white powdery sandy beach, having our breakfasts on the small deck overlooking the ocean in the shade of the palm trees and lazing on the beach, looked after by the lovely staff. Our room was  spacious and very comfortable, furnished in the local style  (wood and beige stone). We also enjoyed walking to the more animated part of the beach, eating in the jungle, and shopping at the very cool boutiques.

Everything about Encantada was wonderful!! The employees—front desk, bartenders, waiters—were constantly attentive and responsive to our every need. Breakfast, juices, snacks, and the cocktails were unbelievably delicious. The room was so well kept- and the bed and pillows, I could’ve slept all day but did not want to miss out on lounging in the sun under the cute cabanas. I scoped out others resorts and this was divine. They even leave little treats at night! Paradise- amazing location to unwind or spend time with friends or a loved one!!

we were originally supposed to stay at the randoo hotel (in the sister hotel in the jungle) however the dark climate was not for us so we were offered the encantada hotel and the nest tulum.  The service in all these three hotels is really great, they try to make the customer feel great and have only the most beautiful memories, for which we are really grateful to them.  We received a wonderful apartment with a sea view on the last day of our stay - it was really a wonderful gesture from the hotel manager.  The food is also very delicious.  I recommend and greet all hotel staff

We have previously stayed at Encantada in one of the gorgeous rooms with ocean views and can attest to the understated luxury and tranquility of this truly boutique hotel. We returned to Tulum this past week and although unfortunately we were not able to stay at Encantada, we did stop by for breakfast and again for lunch. It was a lovely experience. The food was fresh and delicious, the mezcalitas were strong, and the oceanfront setting so tranquil. Best of all, Ana and Juan took great care of us and made us feel so welcome, even though we were not guests of the hotel. As our previous experience, it’s the staff that make Encantada the special place that it is, they make you feel like family. I can’t wait to return for another stay.

We have just returned from a week in paradise.  Encantada Tulum was everything we looked for and more. Starting with the warmest of welcome. Room was beautiful and virtually on the beach. The concierge team is amazing. Nothing is a problem. We just loved our time in Encantada and definitely plan to return. It really was a peace of heaven . Also thank you to all the wonderful people working there .

Encantada is as close to paradise as you can get. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make sure our honeymoon was perfect (which it was). Breakfast on the beach deck was delightful. The Cenote experience was also breathtaking :)

Encantada ist one of the most beautiful and private hotels we’ve ever been to. The guys from the concierge team are the nicest people, who try to make your holidays the best ever.. and they have outdone themselves (our love goes especially to Alejandra). The rooms are so lovely and clean, the direct beach access is great and very private and they make the best homemade granola for breakfast.  Thanks to the Encantada team we had the best  holidays in a dreamy location and will definitely come back!

If you want 24 hour service being sold overpriced drinks lying on emperor sized beds this isn't for you. If you want the most chilled, friendly spot on the beach then head here but keep it quiet. Amazing location. Perfect, classy set up. Great, helpful people. Amazing breakfast and gorgeous lunch if you want it. Didn't meet Jimmy but his ethos is obviously strong and the atmosphere is perfect if you want to be peaceful but meet a few nice people also looking for an escape. Loved it.

i have been going to casa de las olas for a few years now and i always feel as though i enter a world of complete relaxation when i arrive    i truly believe that my experience there is one of the most relaxing experiences i have had while traveling for pleasure

If Im honest, Tulum is a little bit busy for me but Casa De Las Olas is a sanctuary in the madness. Its right at the end of the beach next to the jungle. Super quiet and calm, great room, cute dogs, lovely people, wonderful breakfast. Had such a lovely stay. Only thing was a bit of a stinky sewage smell in bathroom (but I think thats kind of the norm in Tulum).

No review can live up to the experience of staying at Jimmy's place at the end of the beach road in Tulum. If you're looking for a beachfront high rise with artificially colored drinks served by disinterested local folks then stay away, but if you want something real, something truly special, to stay in a place where you feel as though you're being cared for by old friends, where you can have breakfast under the palms at the communal table and be constantly shocked by the flavors of the best ingredients made by a true master, where you will feel as if you are staying in your own Mexican villa - then there is only one choice. Casa De Las Olas sits beachside abutting the protected land of a biosphere and yet a short stroll from the excellent restaurants and clubs of Tulum. There

Great accommodations, private but accessible to all the fun thing on the tulum beach road. They had great  recommendations and having the ability to name drop casa de las olas to restaurant and bars was nice. Community breakfast was outstanding. They had six bikes for the guest to use which was the best way to see everything on the beach.

My family of five stayed at Casa de las Olas for 5 nights over the New Year, and had a very special experience there. We had been to Tulum once before, and enjoyed our stay at the busier end of the beach. This time we discovered the much quieter end of the beach, now my favorite place in Tulum! Casa is literally the last hotel on the beach before the Biosphere of Sian Khan - a very beautiful location. The hotel consists of two main buildings, which once comprised a private villa.  We stayed in the lower level suite of the house facing the ocean, "front row seats" as it were. Our suite included a large terrace from which to take in the sunrise over the ocean, through a filter of swaying palms. The suite is really a great room with four large french doors opening onto the terrace-

After the 6th Trip in 2 years we have fallen deeply in love with this place.  As I looked over the review from 2 years ago (see below)  it all holds true to this date,  But it it even better in some ways.  An additional suite has been added (the owners former apartment) and a wonderful rooftop yoga deck has been opened.  Yoga is three morning a week at 8:00 and doing yoga while looking over the tops of the palm trees is pretty magical.  There have been a few changes in the staff - most notably a new cook but the food is the same high quality.  Over this two year period we have visited in January, August and November.  Each season is a little different - much quieter of course in the summer.    Even in the summer the lack of AC is not an issue as there are fans and the place is

We had a truly amazing stay at Casa De las Olas. The space, ground, and most of all staff were beyond what we could have hoped for. The entire crew went out of their way to make us comfortable and get to know us. We took them up on as many suggestions as we could and they did not steer us wrong. What a truly wonderful vacation. I wish I could still wake up hearing the waves and wind in the palm trees.

This is by far the best experience beach experience i've ever had.  The rooms, the beach, the location, the staff...amazing. Relaxing from the moment I arrived. If you want totally chill, total relaxation, and laid back...this is it!

I absolutely loved staying at Casa De Las Olas! It was sooo beautiful and relaxing. The food was amazing and the room was so lovely and comfortable! I didn’t want to leave! Jimmy and his staff were all wonderful and accommodating with what ever we needed or wanted. I can not recommend this place enough! I will be back with friends and family !!

Beautiful location, the most delicious food, peaceful and hidden away from the craziness of Tulum. The team couldn't have been lovelier, every detail was thought through - highly recommended for solo or group travel.

Small private property at end right before reserve.   We were happy not to be smack in the middle of town.   Breakfast and lunch were amazing.   They figured out how to keep it casual while attention to every detail.   Great staff and experience.   Perfect place to decompress we will be back.

We were in the junior room which was right up against the beach. The waves and wind rocked us to sleep each night.  It was the perfect size for the two of us. Great place, great food and friendly owner and staff. Good doggies too!

Casa de las Olas was a wonderful retreat, both from our regular lives and from the (happy) craziness that seems to exist further up the beach. Our room was peaceful, beautiful and comfortable. We fell asleep to the sound of the ocean each night. The design of the place is both comfortable and minimalist, no over the top frills but everything you need. Our host Jimmy is truly focused on sustainability which we valued, as well as caring a lot about his guests experience. No hum of a generator ever present, smart design instead of air conditioning, cenote water showers (cenote water is full of minerals and slightly salty, do not expect perfect hair days!) etc. The beach is steps away, the grounds are small and beautiful, and every day we started in the palm grove for breakfast and

Casa de las Olas sits on the most beautiful beach we have every seen - you can walk for miles in both directions, both very different from each other.  It is the last property before the Sian Biosphere - so going south is virtually undeveloped.  Going north you will hit hotels and a few beach bars - so the best of both worlds.   there are a number of nice lounging areas on the beach, complete with a hammock.  The grounds are equally lush and beautiful - palm trees and lush foliage everywhere.  Our room was as pictured - we had the small ocean front room that has a beautiful view of the beach.  Because it is off the grid it has no air conditioning but that was not an issue - the ocean breezes kept us cool at night.  Breakfast is included and was very good - it includes fresh

What a delightful beach front get away, that truly is a sustainable hotel.   Stayed in an oceanfront balcony suite, that was so bright and airy that made sleeping at night easy. Kept the doors slightly cracked allowing the ocean waves lull us a sleep -- AC was not missed. Flowing through a yoga practice on the deck was such an experience- wish all yoga classes could be like that! The staff is beyond wonderful; the owner Jimmy along with manager Mara, Bear and chef Pepe felt like family by the end of the week. Placing the long great table in the center of the property invited all to sit, eat, chat and share experiences with one another. It added to the ambiance of Olas and magic of Tulum.  Being the last hotel before the biosphere kept the beach area feeling private and intimate.

Tulum has been a magical place for my husband and I, it was our first "film" trip we did together experiencing the Riviera Maya "Juntos". Unfortunately, so much of that has changed over the past 4 years with commercialization and over-tourism in that area.   Fortunately, Olas Tulum has kept that natural magic. And proves that being 100% sustainable can be beautiful accommodations without harming the natural eco-sphere. I loved how my hair and skin felt using the clean salt waters from the ocean and local products from Lolita Lolita. The food was truly an art, with flavors beyond words. The sounds of the ocean that wake you up and in the morning, calling you, and peacefully put you to bed at night, soothing your mind.   Yes, they have solar panels from above, and remove of their

We loved everything about our stay at Casa de las Olas (or "at Jimmy's", as my children decided to rename it, so dazzled were they by the charismatic owner!). The property is beautiful and incredibly far up Tulum beach, so you have the beach front virtually to yourself. The eco-credentials at Olas are impeccable, and you can learn a lot about sustainable living by talking to Jimmy about the choices he's made. All the recommendations we received from Jimmy and his manager Mara were fantastic, from cenotes to visit to restaurants to try. We loved the communal breakfasts and friendly atmosphere. One night we crept from our beds to see a turtle laying her eggs on the beach just a few steps from our room, and watched baby turtle hatchlings swim into the sea. A really special place to

Re only got to stay at Casa de las Olas for 3 nights, which was way too short  We had a lovely stay and found our beachfront unit to be calm and relaxed.  Jimmy, Mara and Lisa were all amazing and went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  My wife has very strict dietary requirements but that was no hassle for Lisa who adapted recipes to make sure we got what was needed.  The food was amazing and fresh and healthy!!  Tulum is a busy little place but Olas is a calm gem in amongst the activity!

We've stayed at Olas 3 times: twice as a couple and once with family. The food is thoughtful, healthy, and delicious. The owner and staff are friendly and ultra helpful. The beach feels like your own private beach. Most of all, Olas is eco-friendly and represents the best of Tulum. As someone who is a repeat client, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Tulum.

Loving Olas!  Enjoyed every minute. Rooms are spotless and comfortable. Love having a fridge. Breakfast was amazing every day. We ordered lunch too, so that we could relax the day away. Will definitely be back.

My wife and I went to Tulum for our honeymoon and could not be happier that we landed on Casa de las Olas as the place we decided to stay. We actually booked rooms at two different places while we were in Tulum, and the second place was so underwhelming that we actually left after one night and went back to Casa de las Olas. Just a few of the things that stood out:  -Every morning we woke up and Lisa was cooking something delicious.  -There were a few dogs on the property that were all very nice. They don't bug you if you don't want to be bugged, but if you want to rub their bellies they certainly won't turn you down. -The breeze! If you are worried that it is going to be too hot because there is no A/C, don't be. This place really is designed to keep you cool in your room.

Casa de Las Olas is an amazing, boutique hotel at the end of the main strip in Tulum. A beautiful very private section of the beach, warm hospitality, comfortable rooms and great breakfasts await every day. Easy walking distance to some of the restaurants on the main strip, or simply walk down the beach. We stayed for 4 nights and wish it could have been longer. Would recommend to anyone looking to go to Tulum and have a quieter stay then some of the bigger hotels provide, while still being able to enjoy any nightlife and other attractions in the area.

If you're looking for a place which gives you peace and quiet in Tulum, this is it. Fantastic host, superb location (right on the beach). It's not the place you'll spend all day at but a great base for activities in the area.

This is the 5th time we have visited Olas, and it continues to provide a relaxing haven against what has become a very crowded Tulum. Once you pass through the front gates, the stress melts away, the relaxation begins, and it is a place you will not want to ever leave. The people who work there treat you like old friends, the food is fresh, vibrant and incredible, the rooms are comfortable and clean, the ambience is amazing, and I can wholeheartedly recommend Olas for anyone who enjoys great food, great location, great people and total relaxation!

I'm happy to have found this place. The ambiance and personal attention they offer to their guests was really genuine. The place is sustainable, cozy, clean and private with a lovely staff. Would definitely re-visit again.

Casa de las Olas has been a wonderful place for me to unwind and enjoy all that it has to offer. It's low key vibe further adds to its exceptional uniqueness . It truly is a small piece of heaven . The atmosphere, staff, and overall beauty has always been a delight. I have stayed at Olas many times in the last few years and have enjoyed staying in most of the rooms  What can I say but that I'll be back sooner than later

Cosy, family-run boutique, a feel of a home rather than a hotel. A truly eco-friendly stay at the quiet end of Tulum, away from the hustle and bustle and neighbour to the Sian Ka'an Nature reserve.  A laid-back style and run fully, sustainably. The beach is quiet, turquoise, white sand, private and yours.  The suites are modern, relaxed and comfortable. Breakfast is served under the palm trees, on a large communal dining table. You have all the privacy you need and be social if and when you feel like. All food is so fresh, simply delightful, better than most restaurant food and served at your convenience. Just the food enough is some of best you'll ever experience. Nothing is a problem, Jimmy and his team do the utmost to make your stay like a home rather than a hotel.  You'll

My boyfriend and I took a trip to Tulum and stayed at Casa de Olas.  Right away we were welcomed by the owner, Jimmy, who introduced us to his wonderful manager and staff.  They did everything imaginable to make us feel welcome and were genuinely friendly.  The property itself is gorgeous - the photos don't even do it justice. When we went down to the beach, we were totally overwhelmed by it's beauty and intimacy.  It feels like your own private beach. The sand is really fine and white, the water is crystal clear and there no seaweed - its perfect for swimming and relaxing on the comfortable lounge chairs with cold beers.   Olas is located far enough away from the center of Tulum strip that you don't have to worry about listening to the thumping club music all night, but its

I stayed for around 4 nights, 3 days at Casa de La Olas in December.   It was my first time to Tulum and I loved the position of this small intimate boutique hotel - the very last property right next to the Sian Ka'an Biosphere reserve and away from some of the rather haphazard developments further up the coast.   This place is pretty special. I was travelling heavenly by myself and really just hung out at the beach and ate their temptingly brilliant food- but this place is close to all the sites in the area. (The owner and manager are super helpful at recommending things should you want it).  Id thoroughly recommend it for all types of travellers and imagine you could also block book for a few families going with I think around 8 rooms (might have that wrong?!).   Swimming was

Let’s face it, if you’ve come here you come back because you’re embraced as family from the moment you walk on the property. In a place where social media and trendy tourists try to homogenize experiences, Olas remains an oasis of calm for travelers that appreciate that sun and sea breeze are much more soothing than dj beats by the pool bar amid a sea of selfie-takers. I’ve been to Tulum at least eight times and stay at Olas exclusively after I found it on my third trip. Truly feels like home away from home. Yes, the fruit is the freshest, breakfast convo is lively, and the scenery breathtaking, but it’s the people that make Olas so inviting. They’ve turned me on to some amazing experiences, meals and hidden gems of the Yucatan. I brought a group of friends down to celebrate a

Stayed at Olas in November 2019 to wind down from a yoga teacher training. It’s my 5th visit and I wouldn’t dream of staying anywhere else. Beat location on the beach for getting away from it all. The water was blue, warm, and clear of seaweed. Perfect place for morning sunrises. Daily scratch-made breakfast, coffee, and juice is included. Free bikes make it easy to get around town or for a trip to town. The staff was extremely helpful with local advice on restaurants, shopping and excursions. They now have a rooftop yoga studio available for guests! Again, this place continues to impress.

Olas was the perfect hidden gem we were looking for in Tulum. The friendly home like feel where the jungle meets the beach. Abby and the Olas Team were incredible. My wife and I have traveled the world, and it’s safe to say we’ll be coming back to join the team at Olas many more times.

We visited las Olas as for a special occation and the staff made it even better than we had in mind. The beach is amazing, its very private, allowed us to have friends time together. The staff was outstanding, helped us with everything we needed and was super friendly and relax. I absolutely reccomend this hotel for a romantic occation so as for a fun time with friends! Will go back for sure.

A great location right before the entrance to the nature reserve, the beach is more secluded then anywhere else I have stayed in Tulum. The grounds are lush and peaceful and offer plenty of tranquil shade. Santiago was a gracious host who took care of everything we could ask for.  Clean and well appointed rooms with outstanding views of the ocean. Will be back for sure.

This place really is incredible if you're looking for a relaxing get away with incredible views of both the ocean/white sandy beach direct from our balcony or make use of the amazing roof terrace to watch the sunset with full panoramic scope of the breath taking Tulum jungle with not a single building or neighbouring property in site!  Clo & Jimmy were super welcoming, great hosts with fantastic local knowledge & recommendations for sightseeing, restaurants, bars etc...   The food was organic, homemade and put many large hotel chains and high end restaurants to shame! Breakfast was always a treat with fresh local fruit, homemade granola as well as the main plate which was always a tasty surprise with a mexican twist. The Eggs & Tortilla with chocolate mole was something new for

We stayed at Olas for two weeks whilst visiting Tulum and couldn’t recommend it more - the location on the beach was incredible, it was quiet and secluded despite being a 5-10 min walk along the beach to some of the most popular beach clubs, hotels and restaurants. The rooms were very spacious, cleaned every day and had great amenities including a fridge and kitchen area. Fernando, the chef at the hotel, was insanely good - the complimentary breakfast each day made waking up something to look forward to, and we opted to have lunch at the hotel more often than not after discovering that the meals were better both in terms of quality and value than anywhere else we ate. Abby, the hotel manager, was absolutely fantastic - went above and beyond to accommodate all our requests and

This gorgeous place is located at the very end of Tulum away from all the partying so if you're wanting a quiet beautiful place to stay that's still close, this is it! The rooms are wonderful and like you have your own oasis right on the beach. The people there are extremely welcoming and helpful too! Highly recommend!

Casa Olas is an oasis at the end of the Tulum strip that is tranquil and beautiful. It overlooks the biosphere, which is so vast and serene. My daughter and I stayed for 6 nights and were well cared for by Abby, Maria, and Fernando. Fernando is an incredible cook and we ended up ordering most of our lunches from him as well as breakfast. Abby gave us wonderful suggestions of places to visit around Tulum. Abby, Fernando, and Maria were so friendly and always available to us. We loved Casa Olas so much that I recommended it to a friend and she will be visiting this month.  If you choose Casa Olas, you can be sure to have a wonderful vacation.

My husband and I love Tulum, well, the Tulum that was. We still enjoy Tulum now, but would not go back unless we could stay at Las Olas. Olas is perfect. It has the vibe of the original Tulum, with the look of new Tulum. You can spend your day in peace and quiet at Olas, then walk down the beach or take a bike to go to the main street of the Tulum hotel/beach zone. Five minutes of pedaling, and you're in the shops, restaurants, clubs, etc. Then when you're done, pedal back to the peace of Olas and sleep with the sound of waves as your lullaby. And the stars! We love biking back for the view of the stars alone (or from Olas' rooftop lounge area!) If you're fortunate enough to stay at Las Olas, take our advice - eat breakfast and lunch there. The food is beyond amazing, and the

I love Tulum and have been many times but in recent years the development and party scene on the main beach road have become a little much. Olas Tulum is perfect for those wanting to soak up the incredible nature of coastal Yucatan in peace (it is literally the last structure on the beach road before the entrance to Sian Kaan ecological reserve), but also have access via bike/taxi/beach walk to all the hip jungle restaurants etc on the more developed tract of the beach road towards town. The property is amazing - perfect beach, perfect interior shaded by palms and the typical greenery of Tulum that creates that sun dappled magic. The rooms are simple but provide everything you need and the views & falling asleep to the waves at night cannot be beat. One of the few places in

Olas Tulum is the most relaxing spot in Tulum, hands down. Located at the end of the beach road, bordering the nature preserve, it is beautiful, private, extremely well maintained, has an incredible chef, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the entire experience is peaceful and calm. I would recommend Olas Tulum to anyone who is looking for an experience unlike any other in Tulum, one that is calm, peaceful and relaxing.

I hadn't been back to Olas or Mexico for 8 years when I finally made my return this year. The timing was perfect but I was concerned about how much Tulum had blown up since and that maybe Olas had changed too.  Well I was right about both Tulum did blow up and Olas just got better.  Even back then Olas was an escape on Tulum beach and now more than ever. Blessed with undeniably the best location on the beach front they have really made the most of it and grasped that spot  to make it a unique retreat. I enjoy some of the restaurants nearby but this time I had no excursions, no tours, no diving , just re-energizing. It worked. The chef there is very talented also. A delicate hand he uses local produce wonderfully and I really enjoyed everything I tried, Mexican Shakshuka .. right

Olas is really incredible. Abby and her team were so welcoming and accommodating. It's a bit south of the main strip, which was ideal for me as I don't like the clubby, "Burning Man" scene Tulum has become. Olas felt connected the nature and so serene. The beach is quiet, the food is fantastic, and the rooms are lovely. I would definitely return. Thank you for everything!

You see the word 'oasis' used to describe Olas a lot in its reviews on this site, and for good reason - it really is.   If you've never been to Tulum before, there is only one pretty tight, two lane road about 6 miles long into the resort area. Olas is right at the end of this road, the last commercial property before you enter a beautiful nature preserve.   The property feels more like you're visiting friends who live there than a resort. It's small - probably only accommodates a dozen or so guests at any one time. The rooms are simply but thoughtfully decorated, and look right over the beach (our balcony was at best 25 yards from the waters edge). They are set up in 'shotgun' style, so we has a nice breeze blowing through the room all the time.  Breakfast is included with your

I was in desperate need of some quiet adult time - away from all devices and large crowds.  This hotel was PERFECT, it felt like a home away from home.  The staff was lovely and very responsive.  I was looking for an authentic community experience, the people we met were nice and had the same mind set.  If you're looking for real relaxation and privacy - THIS is the place! If you are traveling with someone who enjoys the night life  this isn't too far from the bars and restaurants.  We rented a car but didn't really use it that much, only to go into town a few times for cash.  This is right next door to a wild life preserve and a Cenote!!  USE BUG SPRAY 24/7 =-)

My sister and I stayed at Olas Tulum for 4 nights.  The setting is so nice and quiet as it is located at the far end of Tulum Beach Road away from the mass of people.  We were easily able to ride the bikes they provided to shop or eat but then come back to the quiet to a beach with no one on it.  Fernando and Mary were our fabulous hosts providing wonderful food and service.  Definitely recommend a stay!

If you're in Tulum for more than the beach and nightlife, this is the place for you. Quiet serenity awaits at the end of the beach road where the neighboring property is quite literally the Sian Ka'an Biosphere. A walk up the beach takes you into the zone of bikinis, beach clubs, incredible eating opportunities, and plenty of shopping.  A walk down the beach takes you into nature and a wilder side of Tulum.  Olas is truly a private B&B with a private chef whose breakfast and lunch offerings are the best Tulum has to offer. Rooms are large and comfortable with minimal, but thoughtful furnishings and offerings including jugs of filtered water, beach towels, and screened windows and sliding doors.. Meals are served al fresco at large tables beneath the shade of a palm forest, and

Olas is a dream. Secluded, quiet, and away from the busy part of Tulum. The hotel is small, so we had a lot of space and what felt like a private beach just to ourselves.   They also have a few bikes you can take to ride onto the main stretch of town to go out to dinner or go shopping.  We were met with utmost hospitality and felt completely taken care of. Fernando makes some of the best food we had in Tulum (you must try his quacamole!)   The room was spacious and had a direct view to the sea. We fell asleep each nigh to the sound of the olas :)   Highly recommend for anyone looking for a relaxing and nourishing trip to Tulum!

We loved that Olas was one of the last hotels on Tulum beach, a short bike or cab from the restaurants and nightlife which meant that this allowed for quiet, privacy, and real relaxation. Eco-friendly, next to Sian Kaan, real authentic service and hospitality.

What a find, Olas Tulum is a dream, the team are tremendous and the property is brilliantly designed.  The food (breakfast and lunch) is outstanding, and the outside dining area is the perfect spot to enjoy it! It's immaculate and comfortable, so it's the perfect place to relax. The location is right next to the jungle meaning it's wonderfully peaceful and close to nature, and away from the very busy and noisy parts of Tulum. Did I mention the team are incredible?!

Olas is what I think is best of Tulum. There are two kinds of Tulum. There is the party scene and there is the quiet, beautiful, and relaxing Tulum that I love. Olas best exemplifies this experience. Modest and secluded. Delicious food and breathtaking views. Nearly everyone that stays there is a return guest or will be.

I love this place and I can’t wait to go back. Fernando cooked amazing food everyday and made our experience great. The views from the room and on the beach were outstanding. Definitely my favorite place to visit in Tulum.

The food was delicious and the service was great! We have the best time spending our days at the beach relaxing. The breakfast was incredible every morning and the lunch was also equally amazing. This is the perfect place to lay back and relax.
