My husband and I stayed in Olas for a week and we really enjoyed it. It is a secluded hotel, which is great when you're looking to sunbathe and relax in peace and quiet. The beach is almost private, with the occasional person going for a walk along the beach (we were completely alone 90% of the time). The breakfast at Olas is something else. The food is simple, but very good. They serve coffee, juice, fruit with yogurt and the world's most delicious granola and a savory dish that changes every day. Even though you can't choose what you'll be having for breakfast Fernando (the AMAZING cook) can always accommodate any food restrictions. The kitchen is also open for lunch (you can choose from a menu), but they don't serve dinner.  A few points to pay attention:  - The rooms don't

My Mom and I recently stayed at Olas.  We both wanted to get away after the pandemic, it was our first vacation in forever and we were missing the beach so we chose Tulum as our destination.  It was our first time staying at a sustainable boutique hotel.  I don’t think we truly appreciated just how precious this decision was until we experienced Olas.  It was AMAZING!  Each day during our stay we fell in love with the place a little more as it unveiled more of its charm.  This truly is a gem!  We stayed in the Oceanview villa in the Deluxe Balcony suite.  On the property there are two main structures, one is the ocean front villa and the other is the ocean view villa.  They are nestled in the jungle right on the beach with a private gate.  Be sure to know your gate code upon

As a nature lover I felt right at home.  Turtles, butterflies,  effervescent dragonflies and of course "IGGY" the iguana ~ keeper of the property.   The food was amazing.   The staff was wonderful. All my needs were met.  I can't wait to go back!

Our stay at Olas was fantastic: quiet, private, beautiful and warmly welcoming. Olas combines the best aspects of a boutique hotel (beautifully designed and maintained rooms and property, great food, deluxe amenities) with the atmosphere of peaceful seclusion you’d get renting a private residence.   Having only a few guests at a time, the staff are responsive and accomodating, more than happy to advise you about stuff to do or arrange an on-site massage. Although you can get around just fine using taxis, and driving the beach road can be…a bit of an adventure, we’d advise renting a car—which you’ll want to do anyway if you’re planning on getting out to see the cenotes or ruins, or dining in Tulum Pueblo.  Olas Tulum is exactly as advertised and very much lives up to its great

This was my second time staying at Olas and our first trip post-pandemic. We could not have chosen a better place to get away from it all after being cooped up at home for the past year!  Olas is tucked away on a quiet stretch of the beach road, away from the “scene” in Tulum. The view and proximity to the ocean cannot be beat. We did opt for one night out on the town but mainly stayed in, enjoying the sound of the waves and cool breeze from our spacious balcony. What a way to relax!  What also makes Olas special are the people you will meet. We love sharing the communal table with other guests and hearing their stories. And Chef Fernando is so warm and extremely talented. What a treat to taste (and see) his inventive breakfasts every morning. Tip: you must try the prawn tacos

Just returned to Olas after 10yrs- and the upgrades still ticked all our boxes- beautiful, essentially private beach, peaceful setting, and and eco-friendly, small footprint.  We stayed in the ocean suite with balcony. The room was simple yet spacious. Loved the view, breeze, and sound of waves with the sunrise stirring us awake in the morning (easy transition to the balcony hammock). The staff was very nice and so helpful with excursion recommendations.Meals were so fresh and delicious. The sunsets on the rooftop with amazing jungle views was the perfect aperitif to heading out for dinner.  Won’t wait another 10 years to return!

Everything was top notch. The hotel is perfectly located with jungle around it and directly adjacent to the beach. The hotel is a bit secluded so you get peace and quiet, without traffic and without beach clubs.   We stayed in a larger room directly facing the sea with a large spacious patio. The room was clean and fresh. At night we opened the doors to the sea and fell asleep to the waves crashing against the beach. The cool wind made the room always cool and nice.   Dino who received us was super nice and very helpful. He did that little extra throughout our stay. He knows the best restaurants and bars and really made sure we enjoyed ourselves 100%. It wouldnt have been the same without him.  Mari in the kitchen made the best breakfast every morning filled with love. Do not

I hadn't been to Tulum in four years and was excited to return. I'm so glad we chose Olas! Tulum has really grown a lot in the past few years and it was nice to be away from the crowds and action. The property is just gorgeous and steps from a pristine beach. Our room was lovely and well appointed. The hosts, Dino and Abby, were amazing and so friendly to talk to each day at breakfast - as were the other guests. It felt like a home away from home. Breakfast is included in the rate and their cook is wonderful - so much so that we ordered lunch every day at the hotel, too. Thanks Olas - and especially Dino and Abby - for making us feel welcome and taken care of.

Had a great stay. Beach and swimming wonderful. Has such a friendly low key atmosphere. Food and communal dining were great. Had a wonderful tour in the biosphere. Only downside was our room - junior suite. Choose a better one, they’re much nicer

Authenticity, it's a rare find but you will find it Olas. Magic place, exceptional crew and food. We found our dream place on earth. You wake up and fall asleep to the sounds of waves. In between, you have a beach so beautiful that it looks like a retouched postcard. But it is real.

Las Olas is a truly unforgettable oasis.  Every part of our stay was a unique and incredible experience.  I still dream of the sounds of the ocean that fill your room at night. Everything at Los Olas is done with such attention to quality and beauty.  The staff is exceptional and made a point of going the extra mile to ensure that our stay was the best it possibly could be.  From the delicious food to sipping homemade pina Coladas on the beautiful beach, to the mezcal tasting while watching an incredible sunset, to the beautiful grounds – I highly recommend staying at Las Olas! I will be back!

Las Olas is at the end of the strip in Tulum- a magical oasis away from the chaos.  The beach is private and quiet.  The food and hospitality are amazing.  The staff helped us get reservations at highly desirable restaurants in town. We have returned three times and love it here.  We cannot wait to escape the cold weather in Boston and head back to Las Olas!

We came to rest and found peace and quiet, a very calm oasis that we didn't leave fro few days. The breakfast were amazing and the rooms perfect. The position is really away from all the noise and craziness of Tulum on a gorgeous beach were we saw no one else than the other few couples staying. This is really boutique and for people looking for a more original way of spending vacation time. You can walk to few really good restaurant. Abby was super helpful and the staff on site is like family and very lovely people.
